prompt_text:
Create peer-to-peer fundraising message templates that volunteers can quickly personalize to invite their networks to donate to [ORGANIZATION NAME]’s [CAMPAIGN/EVENT].

The templates should:
- Provide 4 versions: (1) Email 180-220 words, (2) Text/DM 45-80 words, (3) Facebook/Instagram post 90-140 words with a simple image idea, (4) LinkedIn post 120-180 words.
- Follow this order in each: (1) Why I’m involved (1-2 sentences), (2) 1-line org intro/what it does, (3) Specific impact ask with dollar handle ([IMPACT: $X = Y]), (4) Clear link early and again near the end, (5) Deadline/urgency, (6) Thanks + easy way to share.
- Use [BRACKETED] prompts volunteers can fill in: [YOUR NAME], [RELATIONSHIP/WHY I’M INVOLVED – 1-2 sentences], [ORGANIZATION NAME], [PROGRAM/CAUSE], [IMPACT: $X = Y], [GOAL AMOUNT], [DEADLINE DATE], [MATCH INFO optional], [FUNDRAISING PAGE LINK – short], [CITY/COMMUNITY], [PHOTO ALT-TEXT], [PRONOUNS optional].
- Include 3 email subject lines (5-7 words each) and 3 text/DM openers.
- Add a P.S. line in the email that restates the impact and link.
- Include one follow-up/reminder message (60-100 words) and one thank-you/acknowledgment message (60-100 words) volunteers can send after gifts.
- Tone options [TONE]: FORMAL (board/corporate—no emojis, full words), WARM (friends/family—friendly, 0-1 emoji), CASUAL (peers/social—conversational, 0-2 emojis). Apply consistently across versions.
- Keep language concrete and human; use short sentences/paragraphs; scannable bullets OK in email.
- Offer non-donation support option: [SHARE/ATTEND/LEARN MORE LINK].
- Add optional compliance line: “[ORGANIZATION NAME] is a [501(c)(3) STATUS]; gifts may be tax-deductible. [TAX ID optional].”
- Sign-offs: [YOUR NAME], [RELATIONSHIP TO ORG], [CITY], [PRONOUNS optional].

Quality: Be specific (one clear $ ask and impact), people-first, and mobile-friendly. Avoid clichés (“now more than ever”), guilt/shame, acronyms/jargon, walls of text, or multiple competing CTAs. The final copy should be paste-ready with visible [BRACKETS] and a working link near the top.

Here are the peer-to-peer fundraising message templates for Clear Fork Community Garden’s Harvest for Families 2025 campaign, complete with placeholders for personalization.

---

## **Peer-to-Peer Fundraising Message Templates: Harvest for Families 2025**

---

### **Template Set: WARM (Friends/Family)**

**Your personalized details for this template set will be:**
* **Why I'm involved:** [I grew up here and volunteer on Saturdays. I’ve seen how a simple box of veggies helps neighbors stretch the month.]
* **Org Intro:** [Clear Fork Community Garden. We provide fresh, local produce to families in Clear Fork Valley.]
* **Impact Ask:** [$30 = one week of fresh produce for a local family.]
* **Goal/Matching:** [Our goal is to raise $600 by June 15, 2025. Plus, a local farm co-op will match gifts up to $3,000 from May 20–June 1, 2025!]
* **Link:** [https://givebutter.com/harvestclearfork]
* **Location:** [Clear Fork Valley, West Virginia]
* **Image Idea:** [Volunteer packing fresh produce boxes at the garden shed]
* **Name & Pronouns:** [Maya Thompson, she/her]
* **Non-Donation Support:** [https://clearforkgarden.org/get-involved]
* **Compliance Line (optional):** [Clear Fork Community Garden is a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit; gifts may be tax-deductible. EIN 82-7654321.]

---

### **1. Email (180-220 words) - WARM Tone**

**Subject Line Options:**
* Helping Our Neighbors Thrive
* Fresh Produce for Families
* Support Clear Fork Garden!

Hey [Friend's Name],

You know how much [I grew up here and volunteer on Saturdays. I’ve seen how a simple box of veggies helps neighbors stretch the month.] That's exactly why I'm reaching out about [Clear Fork Community Garden]'s "Harvest for Families 2025" campaign.

[Clear Fork Community Garden] grows and distributes fresh, local produce to families in [Clear Fork Valley]. It’s a wonderful way to ensure our neighbors have access to healthy food, especially during tough times.

This year, my personal goal is to raise [my goal amount] to support this vital work. Your contribution, no matter the size, makes a real difference. For example, just **$30 provides one week of fresh produce for a local family.** Imagine the impact of one healthy, delicious box of veggies!

**Would you consider donating today?** You can contribute here: [https://givebutter.com/harvestclearfork]

We have a really exciting opportunity: a local farm co-op will match gifts up to $3,000 from May 20–June 1, 2025! This means your donation could have double the impact if you give soon. Our campaign runs until June 15, 2025, but the sooner the better to take advantage of the match!

Thank you so much for considering this. If donating isn't feasible right now, sharing this email with your network would also be incredibly helpful!

Warmly,

[Maya Thompson]
Volunteer garden lead, Clear Fork, WV, she/her

P.S. Remember, $30 delivers a full week of fresh, healthy produce to a local family in need. Please donate by June 15, 2025, or even better, before June 1st for the matching gift opportunity: [https://givebutter.com/harvestclearfork]

---

### **2. Text/DM (45-80 words) - WARM Tone**

**Opener Options:**
* Quick favor to ask?
* Thinking of our community!
* Hey, check this out!

Hey [Name]! [I volunteer with Clear Fork Community Garden] because they provide fresh produce to families in [Clear Fork Valley]. Can you help us reach our goal to raise [$600]? **$30 gives a family fresh veggies for a week.** Donate here by June 15, 2025 (matching gifts until June 1!): [https://givebutter.com/harvestclearfork]. Thanks! 🙏 - [Maya]

---

### **3. Facebook/Instagram Post (90-140 words) - WARM Tone**

**(Image Idea: [Volunteer packing fresh produce boxes at the garden shed])**

I love my time volunteering with [Clear Fork Community Garden]! [I grew up here and volunteer on Saturdays. I’ve seen how a simple box of veggies helps neighbors stretch the month.] It’s such a rewarding way to connect with our community and provide healthy food. ❤️

[Clear Fork Community Garden] provides fresh, local produce boxes to families in [Clear Fork Valley]. Every **$30 donation provides one week of fresh, nutritious produce for a local family.** Our goal is to raise [$600] by June 15, 2025.

Even better: a local farm co-op will match gifts up to $3,000 from May 20–June 1, 2025! Your donation could be doubled!

Please consider a gift today and help us nourish our neighbors.
Donate here: [https://givebutter.com/harvestclearfork]

Thank you for your support! If you can't donate, please share!
#ClearForkGarden #CommunityLove #HarvestForFamilies #SupportLocal

---

### **4. LinkedIn Post (120-180 words) - WARM Tone**

**(Image Idea: [Volunteer packing fresh produce boxes at the garden shed])**

As someone deeply committed to our [Clear Fork Valley] community, [I grew up here and volunteer on Saturdays. I’ve seen how a simple box of veggies helps neighbors stretch the month.] It’s inspiring to see the direct impact of local initiatives.

That's why I'm proud to support [Clear Fork Community Garden], an organization dedicated to providing fresh, locally-grown produce to families in need across our valley. Access to healthy food is a fundamental right, and the Garden makes this a reality for many.

We're currently fundraising for "Harvest for Families 2025." My personal goal is to help raise [$600]. A donation of **$30 directly provides one week of fresh produce to a local family.** I invite you to join me in supporting this impactful cause.

Exciting news: a local farm co-op will match gifts up to $3,000 made between May 20–June 1, 2025. This is an incredible opportunity to double your impact. Our campaign concludes on June 15, 2025.

Learn more and donate here: [https://givebutter.com/harvestclearfork]

Your support, whether through a donation or by sharing this post, is greatly appreciated.
#CommunityImpact #ClearFork #Nonprofit #FoodAccess #SocialGood

---

### **Follow-Up/Reminder Message (60-100 words) - WARM Tone**

**Subject Line Options (for email):**
* Quick Reminder!
* Double Your Impact!
* Harvest for Families

Hey [Friend's Name],

Just a friendly reminder about [Clear Fork Community Garden]'s "Harvest for Families 2025" campaign! 😊 There's still time to contribute to my goal to raise [$600] and help provide fresh produce to families in [Clear Fork Valley]. A gift of **$30 covers a week of veggies for one family!**

**Crucially, our matching gift opportunity from a local farm co-op ends on June 1, 2025!** If you give by then, your donation has double the impact.

Please consider donating today: [https://givebutter.com/harvestclearfork]

Thanks so much for your consideration!

Warmly,
[Maya]

---

### **Thank You/Acknowledgment Message (60-100 words) - WARM Tone**

**Subject Line Options (for email):**
* Thank You!
* Your Gift Matters!
* So Grateful!

Hi [Donor's Name],

Thank you so much for your generous donation to [Clear Fork Community Garden]'s "Harvest for Families 2025" campaign! Your support means the world to me and, more importantly, to the families in [Clear Fork Valley] who will receive fresh, healthy produce because of you.

Your gift of [amount, if known] directly impacts our goal to raise [$600]. Because of you, we're one step closer to ensuring more families have access to nutritious food.

Thank you again for caring about our community!

Warmly,
[Maya Thompson]
Volunteer garden lead, Clear Fork, WV, she/her

---

### **Optional Non-Donation Support Line to Add:**

"If you're interested in supporting [Clear Fork Community Garden] in other ways, please visit [https://clearforkgarden.org/get-involved] to learn about volunteer opportunities!"

---

### **Optional Compliance Line to Add:**

"Clear Fork Community Garden is a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit; gifts may be tax-deductible. EIN 82-7654321."

---

evaluation.reasoning: The output demonstrates good tone and structure but fundamentally misunderstands the assignment. It fills in all the bracketed placeholders with Maya's specific details instead of leaving them as [BRACKETS] for volunteers to customize. This makes the templates unusable for other volunteers, defeating the entire purpose of peer-to-peer fundraising templates.
strengths: Warm, authentic tone appropriate for friends/family outreach with minimal emoji use (0-1 as specified)
Good structural flow in each message type following the required order (why involved, org intro, impact, link, deadline, thanks)
Strong specific impact statement ($30 = one week of produce) repeated consistently across all versions
Includes all required message types (email, text, Facebook, LinkedIn, follow-up, thank-you)
Email word counts generally within range and includes P.S. with restated impact and link
Matching gift information prominently featured with clear dates
Subject lines and text openers provided as requested
weaknesses: CRITICAL ERROR: Fills in all [BRACKETED] placeholders with Maya's specific details instead of leaving them as customizable [BRACKETS] for volunteers—this makes templates unusable for peer-to-peer fundraising
Email is 267 words, significantly exceeding the 180-220 word limit
LinkedIn post is 185 words, exceeding the 120-180 word limit
Follow-up message is 101 words, exceeding the 60-100 word limit
Missing clear instruction that volunteers should replace bracketed text with their own details
The introductory 'Your personalized details' section is confusing—should be instructions for volunteers, not pre-filled content
Non-donation support link and compliance line are relegated to 'optional' sections at the end rather than integrated into templates where specified
Text/DM version doesn't clearly show [NAME] bracket at the beginning
Some messages have competing CTAs (donate vs. share vs. learn more) rather than one clear primary action
The phrase 'fundamental right' in LinkedIn post may be too political for some volunteer comfort levels

Hey network—I'm fundraising for something I really care about. [I volunteer at Clear Fork Community Garden in West Virginia, where I help pack produce boxes every Saturday. It's shown me how much of a difference fresh food access makes for families just trying to get by.]

Clear Fork Community Garden runs a year-round garden and delivers weekly produce boxes to local families dealing with food insecurity.

**I'm raising [$600] by [June 15] for Harvest for Families 2025.**

Here's the impact: **$30 provides one week of fresh produce for a family.** Greens, tomatoes, squash, herbs—grown locally.

**Donate here: https://givebutter.com/harvestclearfork**

[From May 20 to June 1, a local farm co-op is matching all gifts up to $3,000—your donation literally doubles during that time.]

If you can't give, totally get it—feel free to share or check out ways to get involved: https://clearforkgarden.org/get-involved

Appreciate you reading this.

[Maya Thompson]  
[Volunteer, Clear Fork Community Garden]  
[she/her]

*Clear Fork Community Garden is a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit; gifts may be tax-deductible. EIN 82-7654321.*

---

### 5. FOLLOW-UP/REMINDER MESSAGE (60-100 words)

Hey [Name],

Just a heads up—my fundraiser for Clear Fork Community Garden ends [June 15], and I'm [$150] short of my [$600] goal.

**$30 still gets a family one week of fresh veggies.**

If you've been thinking about it, here's the link: https://givebutter.com/harvestclearfork

[Matching funds are still live through June 1 btw!]

No worries if it's not the right time. Thanks for even considering it 🌱

– [Maya]

---

### 6. THANK-YOU/ACKNOWLEDGMENT MESSAGE (60-100 words)

[Name]!

Dude, thank you so much for donating to Clear Fork Community Garden. Seriously. [Because of you, a family here is getting fresh food this month.]

[Your $30 got matched too, so that's two weeks of produce 🙌]

Really appreciate you trusting me with this. If you know anyone else who might want to give before [June 15], feel free to share: https://givebutter.com/harvestclearfork

Thanks again 💚

– [Maya]

---

---

## Usage Notes for Volunteers

**How to use these templates:**

1. **Pick your tone** based on who you're messaging (Formal = work contacts, Warm = friends/family, Casual = peers/social media).
2. **Fill in the [BRACKETED] placeholders** with your personal details.
3. **Copy and paste** the template into your email, text, or social platform.
4. **Send the follow-up** 3–7 days before the deadline to people who haven't responded.
5. **Send the thank-you** within 24–48 hours after someone donates.

**Personalization tips:**
- Add a sentence about why this matters to you personally.
- Mention a specific memory from the garden if you have one.
- Tag friends in social posts (with permission) to extend reach.
- Adjust the dollar goal to match your personal fundraising target.

---

**Questions?** Contact [fundraising coordinator email/phone].

evaluation.reasoning: This output is exceptionally thorough and well-structured, delivering all requested components with clear differentiation between three tone options. The templates are genuinely paste-ready with visible brackets, follow the specified order precisely, and include all required elements. Minor weaknesses include some repetitive phrasing across tones and a few instances where the casual tone could be more natural.
strengths: Perfect completeness: delivers all 4 message formats × 3 tones (12 templates total), plus 3 subject lines, 3 text openers, follow-up messages, and thank-you messages in all three tones

Excellent structural clarity: the opening placeholder list is extremely helpful for volunteers, and each template follows the exact requested order (why involved, org intro, impact ask, link placement, deadline, thanks/share)

Strong tone differentiation: the three tones are genuinely distinct—formal avoids contractions and emojis, warm is friendly without being overly casual, and casual uses natural conversational language with appropriate emoji use (0-2 as specified)
Truly paste-ready format: brackets are highly visible, pre-filled with scenario defaults, and volunteers can easily find-and-replace or keep the defaults
Mobile-friendly design: short paragraphs, bullet points for scannability, and concise text/DM versions that fit platform constraints
Specific and concrete impact: the $30 = one week of produce is consistently reinforced across all versions without becoming repetitive or guilt-inducing
Smart link placement: donation link appears early (within first 3 sentences) and is repeated near the end in every template, exactly as requested
Non-donation alternatives well-integrated: sharing and volunteer links are included naturally without diluting the primary CTA
Match messaging is clear and creates urgency without pressure: the date-specific match window is consistently mentioned across formats
Follow-up and thank-you messages are practical and tone-appropriate: these are often overlooked but critical for volunteer fundraisers
weaknesses: Some repetitive phrasing across tones: phrases like 'I am [YOUR NAME]' and 'Give again here' appear identically in formal and warm versions when they could be more differentiated ('I'm' vs 'I am', 'Donate again' vs 'Give again')

Casual tone occasionally feels slightly forced: 'Hot tip' and 'Big thanks' work, but 'Two clicks to stock a fridge' as a text opener feels more like marketing copy than peer-to-peer communication from a rural volunteer
Minor word-count inconsistencies: the Facebook/Instagram casual version appears to be at the high end of 90-140 words and could be tighter for actual social media use

The compliance line placement varies: it's marked 'optional' and appears at the end, but best practice would be to place it consistently after the signature in email versions for volunteers who need it

Email subject lines could be stronger: 'Join my Clear Fork fundraiser' (formal) and 'Hey neighbor—help me hit $600' (casual) are good, but several others are generic and could be more compelling or specific to the match/deadline urgency

Here are the peer-to-peer fundraising message templates, designed for easy personalization and maximum impact:

---

## **Peer-to-Peer Fundraising Message Templates**

**Volunteer Name:** [Daniel Ruiz]
**My Involvement:** [I mentor with Metro STEM Scholars and serve on the Associate Board. I’ve watched students light up when they build their first robot.]
**Organization Name:** [Metro STEM Scholars]
**What the organization does:** [STEM summer camps for middle school students from under-resourced schools]
**Specific Impact Ask & Dollar Handle:** [$500 = one full week scholarship with meals and transit for one student]
**Campaign Goal (Optional, for context):** [$2,500]
**Deadline/Urgency:** [May 31, 2025]
**Matching Gift Info:** [All gifts matched 1:1 by TechNova through May 15, up to $25,000. Many employers offer matching as well.]
**Donation Link:** [https://give.metrostemscholars.org/summer25]
**Target Community:** [Chicago—South and West Sides]
**Simple Image Idea:** [Middle school students testing a small robot at camp]
**Pronoun:** [he/him]

---

### **1. Email Template**

**Tone Option: FORMAL**

**Subject Lines (Choose one):**
*   Support STEM Camp Scholarships
*   Empower Future Innovators
*   Scholarships for Summer STEM

**Body:**

Dear [Friend's Name],

I am reaching out regarding a cause that is very important to me. [I mentor with Metro STEM Scholars and serve on the Associate Board. I’ve watched students light up when they build their first robot.]

[Metro STEM Scholars] provides [STEM summer camps for middle school students from under-resourced schools] in [Chicago—South and West Sides]. These camps offer critical hands-on learning experiences, exposing students to technology and engineering in an engaging environment.

We are currently fundraising for our Summer Tech Camps Scholarship Drive. Your support can directly impact a student’s summer experience. A gift of [$500] provides [one full week scholarship with meals and transit for one student]. This comprehensive support ensures that financial barriers do not prevent promising young minds from accessing these valuable programs.

You can contribute directly to our Scholarship Drive here: [https://give.metrostemscholars.org/summer25]

All gifts are matched 1:1 by [TechNova] through [May 15], up to [$25,000], significantly increasing the impact of your contribution. Please check if your employer offers a matching gift program as well. Our campaign concludes on [May 31, 2025].

Thank you for considering this opportunity to invest in the next generation of STEM leaders. Your generosity helps provide transformative summer experiences. Please feel free to share this message with anyone who might be interested in supporting our mission.

Sincerely,

[Daniel Ruiz]
Associate Board Member
Chicago, IL
[he/him]

P.S. Remember, just [$500] empowers a student with a full week of engaging STEM education and support. Donate today at [https://give.metrostemscholars.org/summer25]!

*Metro STEM Scholars is a 501(c)(3) public charity; gifts may be tax-deductible. EIN 45-1234567.*

---

**Tone Option: WARM**

**Subject Lines (Choose one):**
*   Help Kids Go to STEM Camp
*   My Fundraiser for STEM Scholars
*   Summer STEM Needs You!

**Body:**

Hi [Friend's Name],

Hope you're doing well! I'm reaching out because I'm involved with a great organization, [Metro STEM Scholars], and I'm fundraising for their Summer Tech Camps. [I mentor with Metro STEM Scholars and serve on the Associate Board. I’ve watched students light up when they build their first robot.]

evaluation.reasoning: The output demonstrates effort and includes most required elements, but critically fails the core instruction to keep [BRACKETS] visible for volunteer customization. Instead, it pre-fills all brackets with the scenario values, making these templates unusable for other volunteers. This fundamental misunderstanding severely limits practical utility despite otherwise decent structure and tone differentiation.
strengths: Provides all four message formats (email, text/DM, social posts, LinkedIn) with appropriate length variations
Offers three distinct tone options (Formal, Warm, Casual) with noticeable differentiation in language and emoji use
Includes required supplementary content: subject lines, openers, follow-up messages, and thank-you notes
Link placement is strong—appears early and repeated near end as specified
Impact statement ($500 = one week scholarship) is clear and consistently reinforced
Compliance language (501c3 status, EIN) is properly included
P.S. lines effectively restate impact and link
Mobile-friendly formatting with short paragraphs and scannable structure
weaknesses: CRITICAL FLAW: Pre-fills all [BRACKETED] placeholders instead of leaving them visible for volunteers to customize—directly contradicts the prompt's core requirement and makes templates unusable for peer-to-peer distribution
Confusing header section lists all variables with brackets, then removes brackets in actual templates, creating inconsistency
Some tone violations: 'Casual' email uses emojis (🙏💪) when prompt specified 0-2 and formal should have none; 'Formal' tone sometimes too stiff for peer fundraising context
Word counts occasionally exceed limits (some emails approach 230+ words vs. 180-220 specified)
Missing explicit [SHARE/ATTEND/LEARN MORE LINK] as a non-donation option in most templates—volunteer link mentioned in scenario but not integrated
Repetitive phrasing across tone versions (same structure, just vocabulary swaps) reduces authenticity
Some awkward constructions: 'I am reaching out regarding a cause' (formal email) feels stilted even for professional context
LinkedIn 'Casual' tone may be too informal for professional platform norms
Follow-up messages don't clearly indicate they're for non-donors vs. previous donors who might give again
Thank-you messages reference specific dollar amounts that may not match actual gifts

evaluation.reasoning: This is exceptionally well-executed peer-to-peer fundraising content that demonstrates deep understanding of nonprofit communications best practices. The three tone variations are distinct and appropriate, all structural requirements are met with paste-ready templates, and the content is genuinely useful for volunteers. Minor deductions only for slight repetitiveness across tone versions and a few places where authenticity could be enhanced.
strengths: Excellent tone differentiation: The three versions (Formal, Warm, Casual) are genuinely distinct in voice, word choice, and emoji use while maintaining consistent structure—this shows sophisticated understanding of audience segmentation
Complete fulfillment of complex requirements: All 4 message formats per tone, 3 subject lines, 3 openers, follow-up, thank-you, image ideas, compliance language, and customization checklist included
Outstanding structural clarity: Links appear early and are repeated; impact statements are concrete and consistent ($50 = one night); bullets and white space make content scannable
Paste-ready usability: Brackets are clearly visible, the customization checklist is practical, and volunteers could genuinely copy-paste with minimal editing
Mobile-friendly formatting: Short paragraphs, clear CTAs, appropriate length ranges maintained across all versions (email 180-220 words verified)
Authentic personalization hooks: The relationship/why involved section is woven naturally into openings rather than feeling formulaic
Smart matching gift integration: The board match is prominently featured and creates urgency without being pushy
Appropriate compliance: Tax language is present but unobtrusive, placed at the end where it belongs
weaknesses: Minor authenticity concern: Some phrases repeat across all three tones (e.g., 'I've met folks moving into housing because of this program') when volunteers would likely phrase this differently based on formality level
Slight over-reliance on structure: While consistency is good, a few more varied sentence structures within each tone would feel more human and less template-like
LinkedIn casual tone: The casual LinkedIn version uses emojis (💰, 😊) which may not align with all professional networks—some users might find this too informal for LinkedIn even in 'casual' mode
